comment.author: 42400804@N05
comment._content: I'm puzzled about which mental hospital this is.  I live in south-east London which was once in the County of Surrey.  Stamford Hill is a district in north London in the London Borough of Hackney, England, near the border with Haringey.  Springfield Asylum was in Surrey.  Maybe there was a place called Stamford Hill in Surrey in those days - a lot's changed since!

comment.author: 26808453@N03
comment._content: Hi [http://www.flickr.com/photos/42400804@N05/] I originally searched for Springfield Park, based on the information here but it appears that the Springfield Park in Wandsworth no longer exists as Springfield Park. Surrey County Asylum was on the site of what is now Springfield University Hospital. Google maps pinpoints this as SW17 7DJ, but Flickr's map only suggests this is the location of the Central London Golf Course, with no mention of the hospital. The location is Burntwood Lane B229 and Beechcroft Road. - Emma
